intro: Nothoscordum calderense, commonly known as the Calderon garlic. It is a flowering plant native to Mexico, belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, and its leaves are narrow and grass-like. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
